channel.title: Java Bug System
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [JDK-8146132] Excessive output from make test-image
item.description:
Can this output be put under LOG=info ?
Creating libcm01t018.so from 1 file(s)
Creating libcm01t011.so from 1 file(s)
Creating libcm01t015.so from 1 file(s)
Creating libcm01t016.so from 1 file(s)
Creating libcm01t008.so from 1 file(s)
Creating libcm01t021.so from 1 file(s)
Creating libcm01t001.so from 1 file(s)

....

These lines too:

Creating support/test/hotspot/closed/tonga/dist/jars/nsk/jdi/PlugConnectors/LaunchConnector/plugLaunchConnect001/connectors.jar
Creating support/test/hotspot/closed/tonga/dist/jars/nsk/jdi/PlugConnectors/LaunchConnector/plugLaunchConnect003/connectors.jar
Creating support/test/hotspot/closed/tonga/dist/jars/nsk/jdi/PlugConnectors/LaunchConnector/plugLaunchConnect002/connectors.jar
Creating support/test/hotspot/closed/tonga/dist/jars/nsk/jdi/PlugConnectors/AttachConnector/plugAttachConnect002/connectors.jar
Creating support/test/hotspot/closed/tonga/dist/jars/nsk/jdi/PlugConnectors/AttachConnector/plugAttachConnect001/connectors.jar
Creating support/test/hotspot/closed/tonga/dist/jars/nsk/jdi/PlugConnectors/AttachConnector/plugAttachConnect003/connectors.jar
Creating support/test/hotspot/closed/tonga/dist/jars/nsk/jdi/PlugConnectors/TransportService/transportService003/connectors.jar
Creating support/test/hotspot/closed/tonga/dist/jars/nsk/jdi/PlugConnectors/TransportService/transportService001/connectors.jar


These lines too:

Creating support/demos/image/scripting/jconsole-plugin/jconsole-plugin.jar
Creating support/demos/image/management/FullThreadDump/FullThreadDump.jar
Creating support/demos/image/management/JTop/JTop.jar
Creating support/demos/image/management/MemoryMonitor/MemoryMonitor.jar
Creating support/demos/image/management/VerboseGC/VerboseGC.jar
Creating support/demos/image/jvmti/heapTracker/heapTracker.jar
Creating support/demos/image/jvmti/minst/minst.jar
Creating support/demos/image/jvmti/mtrace/mtrace.jar
Creating support/demos/image/jfc/Java2D/Java2Demo.jar
Creating support/demos/image/jfc/Stylepad/Stylepad.jar

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Changeset: 0ea2dd1f
Author: Erik Joelsson <erikj@openjdk.org>
Date: 2023-01-23 20:51:13 +0000
URL: https://git.openjdk.org/jdk/commit/0ea2dd1f77a7925d02ae0136bb40dcc8abf354d9

A pull request was submitted for review.
URL: https://git.openjdk.org/jdk/pull/12052
Date: 2023-01-17 22:18:59 +0000

A pull request was submitted for review.
URL: https://git.openjdk.org/jdk/pull/11930
Date: 2023-01-10 20:48:55 +0000

So I filed this a long time ago and have been living with this but can we please not tell us every single object file that's compiled for hotspot/test? There's almost a thousand lines output by default with make test-image:

Creating support/test/jdk/jtreg/native/lib/libLinkerInvokerModule.so from 1 file(s)
Creating support/test/jdk/jtreg/native/lib/libAsyncInvokers.so from 1 file(s)
Creating support/test/jdk/jtreg/native/lib/libIntrinsics.so from 1 file(s)
...
See attached file "excessive".

I have to scroll up to see what test I was running.

Changing a Hotspot header file, the output from LOG=info gives me what I want, ie. which files are recompiled. I'm not sure if I can get used to the file name without the directory path though. Did you have to take out the directory path?

Building JVM variant 'server' with features 'all-gcs cds closed-src commercial-features compiler1 compiler2 fprof jni-check jvmci jvmti management nmt services trace vm-structs'
Compiling abstractCompiler.cpp (for libjvm.so)
Compiling abstractInterpreter.cpp (for libjvm.so)
Compiling abstractInterpreter_x86.cpp (for libjvm.so)
Compiling accessFlags.cpp (for libjvm.so)
Compiling ad_x86_64.cpp (for libjvm.so)
Compiling ad_x86_64_clone.cpp (for libjvm.so)
Compiling ad_x86_64_expand.cpp (for libjvm.so)
...

I think the default should be LOG=quiet. Then if you have an incremental rebuild, use LOG=info to see which files it recompiles.

Like for the tonga tests there are 707 lines like:
Creating libWindowsExceptionFilter01.so from 1 file(s)
Creating WindowsExceptionFilter02 from 1 file(s)
Creating libLockTest.so from 1 file(s)
Creating libExceptionTests.so from 1 file(s)
Creating libLoadTests.so from 1 file(s)
Creating libProcessUtils.so from 1 file(s)
Creating libLTTest.so from 1 file(s)
Creating libdefine.so from 1 file(s)

Changing a file in Hotspot and libSameObject.c in the tests gets these messages, which is good.

Updating libSameObject.so due to 1 file(s)
Updating libjvm.so due to 1 file(s)

But you need LOG=info to find out which .cpp file changed:

Updating libjvm.so due to 1 file(s)
Compiling classFileParser.cpp (for libjvm.so)
Generating symbol list from object files
Creating mapfile
Linking libjvm.so

So that's nice, but then with LOG=info you get pages of crap about copying image files:

Copying images/jdk/src.zip
Copying images/jdk/demo/jvmti/index.html
Copying images/jdk/demo/jvmti/heapViewer/src.zip
Copying images/jdk/demo/jvmti/heapViewer/README.txt
Copying images/jdk/demo/jvmti/heapViewer/lib/libheapViewer.so

Suggestion: demote this Copying stuff to LOG=debug.

I was thinking of introducing a new LOG=quiet, that would silence all the general progress/information messages normally printed by the default log level. Would that seem like a good idea to you? With that log level, you would essentially only get warnings printed (and possibly a start/end text).
I can't believe anyone cares about the demo output. I think the demos are ancient.

The placement of progress information on the default or info log level has been somewhat arbitrary, but typically "large" components have been on the default level, but "small" on the info level. What you are seeing are at least partly caused by a lot of (closed) small-level compilations.

I think a suitable fix for that is to hide (or rather, move to log level info) output about libraries/jars which consists of just a single file.

I'm not so sure about the demos, though. (Unless they too consists of just a single file).
